physical_appearance:The image shows a turban pin. It is gold in colour. The pin is shaped to be a peacock. The tips of the peacock-shaped ornament wings are pointy and the gold wires are formed into four circles. The peacock-shaped ornament is fashioned to be upright.
subject_terms_1:filigree jewellery ornaments (object genre) goldwork (visual works) decorative art (art genre) worn costume accessories turbans Pavo (genus)
subject_terms_2:Filigree Ethnic jewellery Gold jewellery Goldwork Dress accessories Turbans Peacocks
subject_terms_3:Jewellery Indian costumes
sgcool_label_text:Traditional south Indian jewellery is usually crafted to complement the shape and structure of the parts of the body
 from head to toe. This is an unusual gold filigree turban ornament in the shape of a peacock. This an heirloom collected by Dr. R. D. Gangatharan’s family.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Traditional south Indian jewellery is usually crafted to complement the shape and structure of the parts of the body, from head to toe. This is an unusual gold filigree turban ornament in the shape of a peacock. This an heirloom collected by Dr. R. D. Gangatharan’s family.
